entries.text: Unlit kindling for a pleasantly hot bonfire. You can light it using a fire striker.
Unlit kindling for a fire so cold* that it burns. You can light it using a fire striker.
*Soul fire isn't actually cold.
A warm, cozy bed to sleep your troubles away. Sets your spawn point when right-clicked.
A makeshift bed for much needed rest during long expeditions or in the earlier days of a world. Does not set your spawn point.
Knives are lightweight melee weapons. They can harvest Straw from grasses, and guarentee secondary drops from animals.
Knives are lightweight melee weapons. They can harvest Straw from grasses, and guarentee secondary drops from animals.
Knives are lightweight melee weapons. They can harvest Straw from grasses, and guarentee secondary drops from animals.
Golden tools decently increase drops from certain blocks, like ores. Golden swords on the other hand will increase mob drops.
Leather armour will lightly reduce fall damage.
Chainmail armour is now craftable and will occasionally cause attackers to take damage when they come in contact with you.
Golden armour will lightly protect you from burning damage.
Steel armour and tools will occasionally not lose durability when used.
Rose gold armour will very lightly protect you from burning damage.
Rose gold tools slightly increase drops from certain blocks, like ores. Rose gold swords on the other hand will increase mob drops.

Hoes will allow you to obtain seeds from various foliage such as grass or sandy shrubs, as they normally won't yield any without the use of a hoe. They can also rake through leaves quicker than other tools.

A pair of copper shears. Shears will allow you to gather wool from sheep, as they won't yield any when killed. If these are a pair of shears, what's two of them next to each other called? Two pairs of shears, obviously.
Believe it or not, this claw is basically an edible pair of shears. Shears will allow you to gather wool from sheep, as they won't yield any when killed.

Tea is rarely found in swamps. It's a unique crop in that harvesting it in different stages of its growth will yield different coloured tea leaves. The first stage will yield green tea leaves, the second will yield yellow tea leaves, the third will yield both yellow and black tea leaves and the final stage will yield black tea leaves.

Coffee is found in basalt deltas in the Nether. When planted in the overworld, coffee needs regular crops around it to grow and will cause those crops to wither away. It will grow normally if planted in the Nether. Since you can't sleep in the Nether, at least the caffeine will keep you awake.
Wheat is grown with wheat seeds, which are most commonly found by mowing through any kind of grass using a hoe.
Pumpkins can be found in most grassy biomes, typically in grouped patches. You'll need a Knife to cut them up into slices. You can also carve them with any type of shears.
Melons can be found in jungles. You'll need a Knife to cut them up into slices.
Beetroots are most commonly found on beaches. You'll be able to get them or their seeds from wild sea beets or sandy shrubs.
Carrots can be found in temperate biomes like plains, meadows or forests. You'll find wild carrots growing from the ground, ready to be plucked. Just like onions.
Onions can be found in temperate biomes like plains, meadows or forests. You'll find wild onions growing from the ground, ready to be plucked. Just like carrots.
Potatoes can be found in cold biomes like snowy plains or tundras. You'll find wild potatoes growing from the ground, ready to be plucked. Kind of like carrots and onions.
Tomatoes are most commonly found in arid biomes like deserts or savannas. You can harvest the wild tomato shrubs scattered around those biomes to get them and their seeds.
Cabbages are most commonly found on beaches. You'll be able to get them and their seeds from the wild cabbages growing out of the sand. You can also cut cabbages to use up less of them when cooking.

Rice can be found in swamps with its roots buried inside the dirt and half-submerged in water. When grown, harvesting it normally will drop a rice panicle which you'll have to cut up - but if you use a knife to harvest it, it'll give you the rice directly!
Sweet berries are most commonly found growing in taigas. Foxes love them.
Glow berries are found underground in lush caves. They quell your hunger §oand§r the darkness!

Foul berries can be found growing in maple forests. They'll give you the Foul Taste effect, which will make the next food you eat more saturating while the effect is active. Turkeys love them... for some reason.
Strawberries are found in patches around plains biomes. Strawberries, along with any foods that have strawberries in them, slightly restore your health when eaten.
Mint is typically found on mountains or windswept hills. Mint, along with most foods that have mint in them, give you the Berserking effect.

Bananas are found on beaches hanging off of thick banana stalks with fronds on them. Bananas, along with any foods that have bananas in them, give you the Agility effect. I hear someone named after a certain kind of bread roll really likes them.
Vanilla is found in savanna biomes. You might wanna use some shears when harvesting them. Vanilla pods, along with any foods that have vanilla in them, give you the Vanilla Scent effect.
Flax can be found in the wild in most biomes, and is used to make things like sacks, doormats and rope - it can also be cut, milled or crushed into string.
Cucumbers can be found in the wild in jungles and swamps. They're not used for much, but you can make something funny out of them.
Eggplants are found somewhat sparsely in jungles. They're by far the beefiest out of all the regular crops.
Corn can be found scattered around in all plains-like biomes.

Avocados can be found growing on avocado trees in jungles. You can also grow avocado trees yourself by obtaining avocado saplings or avocado pits. Avocado avocado avocado. Doesn't sound like a word anymore, does it? That's called §ojamais vu.

Propelpearls grow on propelplant canes in the Nether, typically in Nether wastes or crimson forests. Try to harvest the canes without a knife or simply walk into them and you'll be in for an explosive surprise! Propelpearls will also set you on fire if eaten raw, so you might wanna cook them together with something to quell said fire. The canes on the other hand can either be crushed or ground into gunpowder.

After feeding a pig a golden carrot, it will lead you to some buried truffles, which you can dig to obtain... well, truffles. Truffles, along with foods made with them, will grant you the Health Boost effect, temporarily increasing your maximum health.
Coal can be found commonly on high altitudes and is a cheap yet efficient fuel source. It's even more efficient if you pack it into a block... somehow?
Iron can be found near - but not directly at - deepslate level and is an extremely versatile material most commonly used to make reliably powerful tools, armour and various other helpful items.
Copper can be found very commonly both over and underground, though it's less common in lower altitudes. It's used to make copper tools early on and other unique gadgets later in the game.
It can also be used to make decorative blocks that oxidise over time, which can be prevented by waxing them with honeycombs. Together with gold, copper makes rose gold alloy.

Gold is most commonly found near the top of the deepslate layer and is also found in the Nether. It has some magical properties and is used in making rose gold, electrum and netherite. You can also use gold ingots to barter for various items with Piglins.

Cinnabar is found near the lower half of the world and can be seen more frequently as you go further and further down. Rough cinnabar can be polished via sand paper or on a grindstone and then crushed to obtain redstone dust, a conductive powder that can be placed to form lines and make all sorts of machines and contraptions.

Lazurite is found most commonly near the bottom of the world, but is rather rare due to pretty much never being exposed to air. Rough lazurite can be polished via sand paper or on a grindstone into lapis lazuli, a gemstone used to make dye and decorative blocks, but is most importantly used as a sort of fuel for enchanting tables.

Diamonds are most common near the very bottom of the world. They're precious gemstones used to forge some of the toughest tools and armour in the game and some other important items like enchanting tables.

Ancient debris is found in small chunks near the bottom of the Nether. It's said that the Piglins have long since mined up all of whatever ore it was left from, but it could potentially still be forged into something powerful...

Netherite is an extraordinarily powerful metal made from alloying netherite scraps together with gold. It's used to make the strongest, most durable tools and armour in the game. Netherite and tools/armour made with it are impervious to fire and lava. Piglin brutes also often drop netherite scrap.

Zinc is found scattered around at pretty much any altitude underground and is used to make various alloys such as andesite alloy, bronze and brass. You can also use it to make Copycat Blocks, Slabs, Steps and Panels to add extra depth to your builds.

Lead is found fairly frequently deep underground - higher up in savanna biomes - or sometimes in boulders scattered around the world. It's used for crystal glass, bombs, and as a cheaper iron alternative in certain recipes.

Silver is found very rarely right between the stone and deepslate layers underground. It's used to make silver mirrors, exposers, and alloyed with gold to make electrum, a metal used in forging the fastest and second most durable tools/armour.

Electrum is a very powerful metal made from silver and gold. It's used to make some of the most durable tools/armour and can even be preferable over netherite in that the tools are slightly quicker and the armour will increase your movement speed.

Rose gold alloy is made from copper and gold, and is used to upgrade iron equipment to rose gold. Tools upgraded with it retain gold's quick nature (albeit slightly dulled by the copper in the mix) and are a little quicker than diamond tools as a result. Rose gold tools/weapons also slightly increase the amount of drops yielded from blocks and/or mobs.

Steel is a tough metal made by alloying iron with fire charges. It's used to upgrade iron tools or chainmail armour and in making some important components for certain contraptions. Steel equipment is heavy and slow, but quite durable.
Bronze is made by alloying copper with zinc and cinder flour. It has some musical properties and can be used to make some oxidizing building blocks similar to copper.

Brass is made by alloying copper with zinc. It's used in making various mechanical components such as smart chutes and fluid pipes, pulse repeaters and extenders, mechanical arms, inventory cables, bigger funnels and tunnels, etc.
Deepslate ores yield extra drops and are blast resistant. Both stone and deepslate silver ores are blast resistant.

Magnetite can be found near large iron veins deep underground. Deepslate iron ore will occasionally drop magnetite nuggets, and small magnetite geodes covered with obsidian will spawn around the Nether.
Using a magnetic compass will make finding magnetite much easier.
Both types of pickerelweed are found near rivers. When cooked and then eaten underwater, they'll restore your air supply.

Compasses point towards your last set spawn point. If used on a lodestone, they will point towards the specific lodestone to which they were assigned. Right clicking with a compass in hand will briefly display your X and Z coordinates.
Recovery compasses point towards your last death point. Keep one at your base so you never lose track of your lost items!

Magnetic compasses always point towards north, unless there's magnetic interference being caused by any raw magnetite in a 128 block radius, in which case they start glowing and pointing towards that magnetite chunk. Right clicking with a magnetic compass in hand will briefly display your X and Z coordinates, however if there's magnetic interference, it will display the coordinates of the interference's source instead.
Clocks show the time of day. Right clicking with a clock in hand will briefly display the time of day in numerical form.

Spyglasses allow you to zoom your view towards wherever you're looking. Using the scroll wheel will allow you to adjust the zoom amount. When zooming in on a block or entity, its name and/or stats will be displayed in the upper left corner of the screen.
Through the use of a keybind (Z by default), you can instantly use your spyglass from anywhere inside your inventory.
Altimeters show your current altitude. Right clicking with an altimeter in hand will briefly display your Y coordinate.
Atlases allow you to easily map out your surroundings. Putting an atlas and empty maps together in a crafting table or a cartography table will put the maps inside the atlas, ready to be used.
When you have an atlas in your hotbar, it'll display a minimap in the corner (upper right by default) of your screen.
These foods are all feasts - meaning, you can place them down and then take portions out of them, typically with bowls.

By placing down some organic compost and letting it sit for a while, you'll be able to get your hands on rich soil, a high quality soil that doesn't need water to grow crops, but grows crops faster than normal if water is provided. If you can't figure out which crops it grows faster, just remember - if it bone meals, it rich soils!

By placing down some soul compost and letting it sit for a while in the Nether, you'll be able to get your hands on rich soul soil, a hellish variant of rich soil that'll let you grow your propelplants and Nether fungi faster.
Dropped by a creeper when killed by a skeleton, or found in dungeon chests.
Dropped by a creeper when killed by a skeleton.
Found in the Nether inside piglin bastion remnants.
Foxes can very rarely be found holding this disc in their mouths.
Found in buried treasure chests.
Can be obtained by feeding any of the discs that drop from creepers to a slabfish.
Can be obtained by getting a group of chimpanzees to kill a ravager by shooting it with a bananarrow.

Leather scraps can be obtained by cutting leather on a cutting board using shears or dealing the killing blow on a mob that drops leather with a knife. As they're used in the same recipes as normal leather, they'll allow you to save a bunch of leather! You can also salvage some leather scraps from various leather equipment thanks to the cutting board.
Sand paper will allow you to polish rough gems. If you're finding the process too slow, use a grindstone or hand the sand paper to a deployer!
Grindstones can repair and disenchant tools or armour, and directly right-clicking on one with a rough gem in hand will polish the gem. Grindstones can also polish whole rough gem blocks.

When activated with a right-click, a handheld compactor will instantly compact all ores in your inventory into a bigger form. The green setting will turn nuggets/shards into raw ores/ingots/gems, the blue setting will turn raw ores/ingots/gems into blocks, and the yellow setting will do both at the same time.
When activated with a right-click, an item magnet will attract all items nearby towards you.
Echo forks will temporarily add a glowing outline to mobs around you in a large radius, allowing them to be seen through walls.
Trowels will select and place a random block from your hotbar with every use. Perfect for adding some variation to your builds!

When thrown, pickarangs will fly far away, only stopping and flying back after reaching their maximum distance, hitting a block, or a mob. Hitting a block with a thrown pickarang will destroy the block and the pickarang will bring its drops to you. When killing a mob with a thrown pickarang, it will bring the mob's drops to you.
Silver mirrors will glow whenever an undead mob is nearby.
Anvils allow you to repair equipment using materials and experience levels. They'll also let you rename items and combine their enchantments.
Placing a book next to an enchanted piece of equipment will transfer its first three enchantments onto the book at the cost of some experience levels and will destroy the equipment in the process.

The Wand of Freezing is one of four ancient relics. It summons damaging and freezing ice blocks above your foes. It can be rarely found in fortresses of the undead, which are dungeons full of skeletons.
The Cleaver of Beheading is one of four ancient relics. It deals high damage, slows down enemies hit with its sweep attack and has a higher chance to cause mobs to drop their heads.
It can be rarely found in catacombs, which are dungeons full of zombies and tombs.

The Mask of Dishonesty is one of four ancient relics. When worn and sneaking, it will allow you to go fully invisible to mobs and players, even if you're wearing armour or holding an item. It can be rarely found in desert pyramids.

The Conch of Conjuring is one of four ancient relics. It summons vicious fangs that come out of the ground and deal damage in a straight line in front of you. It can be rarely found in jungle temples.
